html:
• Daily deals

Apple charges too damn much for additional storage for Macs and iPads. I got tired of overpaying for internal storage and went for an external SSD instead. The Kingston XS1000 is my favorite — portable, reliable and affordable.

And it’s an even better deal now that Black Friday is coming up: under $75 for a terabyte of storage.

This post contains affiliate links. Cult of Mac may earn a commission when you use our links to buy items.

Save money with an external SSD

It’s flatly ridiculous that configuring a MacBook Air from 256GB of storage to 1TB costs $400. I’m willing to pay the Apple Tax to get good computers, but that only goes so far — and paying four times as much as necessary for storage is too far.

Cloud storage isn’t the best alternative for me. I travel frequently, so finding myself without internet access isn’t unusual. And it usually happens when I’m actually in transit, which is exactly when I want to watch a movie.

That’s why I keep a Kingston XS1000 in my gear bag. With it, my movie collection is always available. And I can easily swap it between MacBook and iPad — even iPhone — depending on which is most convenient. Just connect it with the included USB-C cable.

There are versions up to 2TB, but the SSD is only 2.75 inches by 1.3 inches by 0.5 inches so it’s very portable. And the USB-C port supports USB 3.2 Gen 2, so Mac and iPad users can move data at up to 1,050 MB/s read and 1,000 MB/s write. The Cult of Mac review goes into more detail.

Save on Kingston XS1000 SSD for Black Friday

The Kingston XS1000 SSD is always a good deal, but it’s an even better one if you buy it the week of Black Friday.

The 1TB version ordinarily costs $84.99, but it’s $74.99 after a 12% discount.

Buy it from: Amazon

And the 2TB version would cost $139.99, but it sets you back $119.99 after a 14% discount.

Buy it from: Amazon

Plenty of storage for the money

Kingston XS1000 SSD

4.5

The Kingston XS1000 is about the size of pack of gum but holds up to 2TB. And it can transfer files at high speed, too. Connect it to a wide variety of computers via its USB-C port.

1TB and 2TB versions are available.

Pros:

  • Portable
  • Reliable
  • Affordable
